name: (4E)-4-{[5-(4-nitrophenyl)furan-2-yl]methylidene}-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1194
Reason: The compound has a complex structure with multiple functional groups, each of which can affect the melting point. The base structure is a 5-membered ring, which has a melting point of approximately -10°C. The phenyl group attached to the ring adds approximately +60°C, due to its increased molecular weight and polarity. The furan ring adds approximately +40°C, due to its increased molecular weight and polarity. The methylidene group (-CH2-) adds approximately +20°C, due to its increased molecular weight and rigidity. The nitro group (-NO2) adds approximately +60°C, due to its increased polarity and electronegativity. The overall effect of these functional groups is a predicted melting point of approximately 180°C.
